cab.content: -Copy No.74th Conolusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND key it is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document war CABINET 74 (43).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Friday, May 21, 1943, at 5 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department and Minister ofHome Security.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.Air Marshal.. Sir Douglas Evill,Vice-Chief of the Air Staff.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Vice-Admiral Sir Henry Moore,Vice-Chief of Naval Staff.Lieut.-General A. E. Nye, Vice-Chiefof the Imperial General Staff.Secretariat:Sir Edward Bridges.Mr. Norman Brook.Brigadier L. C. Hollis.Contents.minute no. Subject.12Constitutional Reform.: 3 France .... ....The French Fleet at Alexandria.[25475-2]Future OperationsCeylon ....Page5454 1. The War Cabinet had a discussion on future operations.The Conclusions reached are recorded in" the, Secretary' s standard file of War Cabinet Conclusions. *;constitutional reform.(previous reference: -W.M. (43) 70thConclusions,Minute 2.12. The War. Cabinet were informed that a reply? had; beenreceived: to the telegramf despatched to the Prime Minister., inaccordance with the conclusions reached at their meeting oh the18th iMay. This indicated that the Prime Minister did hot dissent from the decision to communicate to the Ceylon Ministers- thestatement annexed to W.P. (43) 204.iThe- War Cabinet-- ' J'Invited the Secretary of State for the.Colonies to arrangefor this statement to be communicated forthwith to ther Board of Ministers in Ceylon. ' ' :" -France. 3. The War Cabinet were informed that Admiral GodfroyThe French had intimated that he felt obliged to send a signal to the VichyFleet at Government announcing his decision to transfer his allegiance and alexandria; that of his Squadron to General Giraud. The Commander-in-Chief,(Previous Mediterranean, had been informed of Admiral Godfroy's intentionReference: and asked to advise General Giraud to issue an order to AdmiralW.M. (43) 36th Godfroy forbidding him to send this communication to Vichy. it conclusions, was hoped that, if Admiral Godfroy considered that he was placingMinute 7.) himself under General Giraud's orders, he would accept thisinstruction not to communicate with Vichy.The War Cabinet-Took note of this statement and of the instructions whichhad been sent to the Commander-in-Ghief, Mediterranean.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,May 21, 1943.* Pencil 168.f Alcove 287.
